titleStmt.title: John Quincy Adams Diary Digital Project

div.p: 1. VI. Sunday.

lg.l: The Mountains at his presence melt—
They melt like wax, before the Lord.
The Heavens his righteousness have felt.
His glory, all mankind record.
Ye Idols down before him fall—
Fall ye who worship idols vain
For Zion hears the joyful call—
And Judah’s daughters swell the strain
For thou, all other Gods above,
Jehovah, art exalted high:
Hate evil ye, the Lord who love—
His hand, to save is ever nigh.
See—for the righteous, Light is sown
Ye true of heart your voices raise
Rejoice before Jehovah’s throne
And Exalt bless his name, with songs of praise.

div.p: With Mr Nicklin, and Mr. McDuffie to Christ Church. Heard Dr Delancy from Luke 22.19. a Communion Sermon 4th. Sunday in Lent. PM. with Watmough to the Presbyterian Church. Stranger. Ephesians 2.10. Notice that Dr. Beecher would preach this Evening at Dr. Skinner’s Church—Arch, at the Corner of 10th. Street— I went and heard him from Matthew 13.22–23. I was disappointed in the expectation of eloquence— The house was much crowded— I answered a Letter from B. M. Clark concerning an Observatory—
2. V. 15. Monday. Psalm 98.

lg.l: Sing to Jehovah a new Song
For deeds of wonder he hath done
His arm, in holiness is strong
His hand, the victory hath won.
The Lord, Salvation hath made known.
His goodness oer the world extends
His Truth to Israel’s house is shown
His Power to Earth’s remotest ends.
Shout to Jehovah, all the Earth—
Break forth in joy, exult and sing
Let voice, let Clarion speak your Mirth
Trumpet and Harp, proclaim your king
Roar, Ocean to thy lowest deep
Shout Earth, and all therein that dwell.
Floods, clap your hands as on you sweep
Mountains the choral anthem swell.

div.p: Morning visitors—T. W. Dyott returned from New-York— Mr Lord of Boston and Committee at the Bank. N. Biddle, the President returned from Washington— Mr Cope, the director, examined—and the President Biddle— Also Manuel Eyre. Loans to James Watson Webb, M. M. Noah and Silas E. Burrows. Letters from Walter Bowne and James Monroe.— Accounts of Thomas Biddle— President Biddle’s and M. Eyre’s explanations. Clayton moves to Subpoena Thomas Wilson, to which I object. Question postponed— Clayton has reason to believe his testimony material— Paul Beck and J. Connell—Sunday School Union Establishment. W. E. Tucker. Porcelain manufactory—to-morrow Evening.
3. IV:30. Tuesday.

lg.l: Let Heaven and Earth and seas combine
Jehovah’s holy name to bless
Creation owns his power divine—
The Universe, his righteousness
He comes in judgment to display
Resistless might and boundless grace
The world with equity to sway
And blessings shed oer all our race.

div.p: Psalm 99.

lg.l: Jehovah reigns—ye Nations shake—
Between the Cherubim enthron’d
Earth, from thy firm foundations quake
God is Jehovah—God alone.
On Zion is thy awful name
Exalted o’er the Nations high.
Let all Mankind thy praise proclaim
All speak the king of glory nigh.

div.p: Persico. told me he had received from his brother a Bust for me— Is to ship it to C. F. A. at Boston.
Bishop White—84 to-morrow.
At the Bank— Examined Lippincott and John T. Sullivan—directors. Clayton renews motion to subpoena Thomas Wilson—

Thomas and Charles Biddle’s accounts— I asked the name of the informer which Clayton refuses to give— I ask entry upon the Journals. Clayton reduces the charges to the form of Resolutions— Adjourn. After dinner I visited with Coll. R. M. Johnson the Porcelain Manufacture of Tucker and Hemphill— At M’Kenney’s He introduced Mr Reason S. Bradford here this Evening.
4. V:30. Wednesday.

lg.l: Thy hands of Justice wield the rod
Thy judgments, wickedness appal
Exalt Jehovah—praise our God
Before his footstool prostrate fall
Moses and Aaron taught his word
And Samuel call’d upon his name
Their prayers ascended to the Lord—
He heard them, and his answer came
He from the Cloudy pillar spoke,
And his Commandments they obey’d
O Lord our God whom we invoke
To them thy Mercies were display’d
Come, to Thy judgments too, didst thou fulfill
Come, to Jehovah raise your songs—
Come—worship at his holy hill
For holiness to him belongs.

div.p: T. W. Dyott here this morning. Committee at the Bank.

James Watson Webb examined on Oath— Cambreleng moves to write to the Presidents of three New-York Banks to refute Webb’s testimony. I object— Cambreleng’s sally Violent Scene between M’Duffie and Thomas. Hardly appeased— Thomas retracts and then recants his concession— Afternoon visits— At J. Sergeant’s— Evening with Watmough and M’Duffie at Manuel Eyre’s. Musical party. Harp—Piano—Violin—Horn—Songs—Miss Walsh—Dorrigo—Supper.
5. V:45. Thursday— Psalm 100.

lg.l: O serve Jehovah, all ye Lands,
Break forth in shouts of joy
Before his presence lift your hands
And thankful songs employ.
The Lord who made us is our rock,
And we are all his own
The People of his Pasture’s flock
And he is God alone
O, with thanksgiving go your way
Ascend his Courts with praise
His goodness oer the world display
And hymns of rapture raise
The Lord is gracious—he is good.
His mercies still are sure
His Truth forever firm has stood.
Forever shall endure

div.p: Joseph Churchman with a Book. By John Jones— Analysis of the Book of Revelations— Seen by my father in manuscript— Quaker controversies. Elias Hicks. Committee at the Bank. Answers of James Watson Webb—read by himself— His explanations. The President N. Biddle gave in answer to some of the Chairman’s queries. Not ready with others.

I gave notice that I should to morrow move a Resolution to fix a day for closing the examination by the Committee of Books and proceedings of the Corporation. This day nothing else was done. I paid an afternoon visit to W. Short— M’Duffie and Watmough dined at Cadwalader’s— Eve at Walsh’s— Clayton and Johnson at Chesnut Street Theatre.
6. V:30— Friday. Psalm 101

lg.l: O Lord, to thee I tune the lay—
Of Truth and Mercy I will sing—
And, walking in thy righteous way.
The tribute of my heart will bring
No Folly shall entice mine eyes
No vice their purity offend.
The ways of Sinners I despise
Nor make the Slanderer my friend.
The haughty look, the froward heart
In me shall no Protector find
From me, the Scorner shall depart
But, I will seek the good and kind
My Soul, the treacherous and base
Far from my presence shall expel
But where exalted worth I trace
With me thy faithful Saint shall dwell.

div.p: Visits from Judge William Rossell, of New-Jersey and Mr Richards Mayor of the City— His invitations. Committee at the Bank— Final examination of James Watson Webb— Answers of the President N. Biddle— Examination of Genl. Cadwalader and of the Cashiers M’Ilvaine, Andrews and Cowperthwait to the impartiality of President Biddle— I offered my Resolution to close the examination next Monday; and then adjourn to meet on Wednesday at the Capitol in Washington— Consideration postponed adjourned at 2— Afternoon visit to the Penitentiary— Convict Stories. Evening at the Meeting of the Philosophical Society— Dr. Chapman in the Chair— Gave my collection of Peruvian Minerals, from A. Armstrong— Wilson of New-York.
7. VI. Saturday.

lg.l: No base artificer of fraud
Shall in my Mansion e’er abide.
And none who scatter lies abroad—
To me shall ever be allied.
No ill thy City shall annoy
For I will raise the vengeful hand
Thy foes each morning will destroy
And sweep the wicked from the land.

div.p: Psalm 102.

lg.l: My prayer, O Lord, Almighty, hear
And let my cry to thee ascend—
To my Affliction turn thine ear
Be thou my Saviour and my friend
My life like smoke consumes away
My bones with fire, as stubble burn’d
My heart is smitten with decay
My bread itself to loathing turn’d—

div.p: Dr. T. W. Dyott— Went with him, judge Clayton his wife and Child and Coll Watmough to the glass works—4. Furnaces each of 8 or nine fires—Viols and Bottles—Shoemakers shop—A School and Chapel to be Union glass works. Saw them blow and Bottles decanters tumblers wineglasses Lamps, Plates and dishes made in our presence—fine cut glass— Cold Collation— Committee at the Bank— Thomas Wilson examined Interest on deposits allowed only to T. Biddle—P. Beck. Whitney. Mackintosh here. After dinner Ride with Mr Johnson Clayton, Thomas and Cambreleng to Resider’s house—once William Penn’s dwelling house— Schuylkill Water works. Bates formerly of Bristol—now of New-York— Visit from him.
8. VI. Sunday

lg.l: My flesh is cleaving to my bones;
By reason of my keen distress
The winds of Heaven repeat my groans
Like echoes from the wilderness
Like As Shrieking of Pelican or Owl
The Silence of the desert breaks
Or as the sleepless lonely fowl
Her? stand who on the house-top takes
My foes their snares before me spread—
I hear their curses, see their sneers—
I eat with ashes mix’d my bread
I mingle with my drink my tears
Thy hand hath rais’d and cast me down,
And all my days like shadows pass
I sink before thy awful frown
And wither into dust like grass.

div.p: Went with Coll. Watmough and heard Dr Bedell from 2. Cor. 7.10.— Deeply impressive. Prayers for 5th. Sunday in Lent— Paid visits to Dr. T. Harris. Jos. M’Ilvaine Watmough’s children, E. S. Burd. T. Cadwalader— S. Richards the Mayor whom we found at dinner. D. W. Coxe— C. C. Biddle &c. After dinner heard Dr M’Caulay. from Jeremiah 17.9.10. Similarity of remarks upon death-bed repentance with those of Dr Bedell in the Morning— Evening Conversation with G. M’Duffie.
9. VI. Monday.

lg.l: But thou forever shalt endure;
And all Eternity is thine
Thy Mercies are to Zion sure—
The time is come for thy design
Thy Servants in her Stones delight
And heathen Lands shall fear thy name
Her dust is precious in their sight
And kings thy glory shall proclaim.
Jehovah Zion’s Walls shall build
The Lord in glory shall appear
The poor shall see their prayers fulfill’d
Their supplication thou shalt hear
This shall the latest time record
And unborn ages speak his praise
While from his throne in Heaven the Lord
The world, with pitying eye surveys.

div.p: At the Bank. Whitney’s Testimony—of 27. May 1824. He swears to a very circumstantial statement which N. Biddle declares to be in every particular utterly false. Andrews. 2d. Cashier of the Bank declares it equally false. Patterson and Burges still to be sworn— Clayton, the Chairman brought a Letter of Recommendation from T. M. Benton to Whitney who has had verbal communications with him in presence of C. C. Cambreleng. Whitney lived in Canada from 1808 to 1816.— Fowle and Russell Hatters here with Memorial. Philip H. Nicklin— Heister. M’Duffie and Cambreleng Evening at C. C. Biddle’s. I decline.
10. VI. Tuesday.

lg.l: To hear the moaning captive’s prayer
And wretches doom’d to death relieve
His praise in Zion to declare
And from Jerusalem receive
But when assembled Nations meet
And kingdoms own Jehovah’s sway
Then weariness retards my feet
My Strength forsakes me by the way.
O God, I say; thy hand withhold
Cut me not off amidst my days—
All Time is thine, and thou of old
Didst Earth from her foundations raise
The Heavens thy handy-work sublime
Shall perish, but thou Lord shall last
Like Garments they shall change with time
And like a vesture off be cast.

div.p: Committee of the Bank. Examination of Patterson first Teller and Burges discount Clerk— Also of Mr Cowperthwait 2d. Assistant Cashier— All contradict the Testimony of Whitney.

Paul Beck also examin’d. Director 1824.5.6 and again 1828.9.30— His Testimony full to the integrity of the President. Clayton petulant. Agreed partially to close to-morrow. Thomas Biddle to be examined. After dinner walk with Watmough— Call on Bishop White, and E. C. Watmough other visits by Card.
Jos. Russell and R. G. Shaw.
11. VI. Wednesday.

lg.l: They with revolving years shall change
Yea, all wax old and waste away—
But thine is Time’s unbounded range
Thy years shall never know decay.
Yes, O my God, thy favour’d race
By thee establish’d and secure.
Shall in the blessing of thy grace
To the last verge of Time endure.

div.p: Psalm 103.

lg.l: O bless, O praise the Lord, my Soul—
And all within me, bless his name
O bless and praise the Lord, my Soul;
And all his benefits proclaim
The Lord, who all thy Sins forgave
The Lord, who thy diseases heal’d
Thy Life, who rescued from the grave—
In crowning Mercy—still reveal’d.

div.p: Joseph Churchman here. His book and Eagle Map. Committee at the Bank. Thomas Biddle testifies N. Biddle proves he was absent from Philadelphia, from 22 to 30. May 1824. Thomas Wilson utterly denies Whitney’s Statement. Andrews and Patterson examined— Whitney desires to correct his testimony; Cross examination of him. Thomas objects and withdraws— Adjourn.
After dinner ride to the newest Asylum— Then to the Sawing and Plaining of boards Establishment. Visits to Jos. Russell. R. G. Shaw—and to J. Sergeant.
12. VI. Thursday.

lg.l: The Lord, thy Mouth with good supplies
As springs soars an Eaglet from the Nest
The Lord, in judgment just and wise
Preserves from wicked men the oppress’d
To Moses, he made known his ways—
Made Israel’s race his wonders know
Justice and Truth, the Lord displays
In Mercy rich, to Anger slow.
The Lord will not forever chide
Not always his displeasure glows
Our sins are with indulgence tried
His kind compassion boundless flows
High as the Heavens this Earth above
The faithful Saint his favour wins;
And far as East from West, his love
Severs from punishment our Sins

div.p: Bank Committee—

Testimony ofSwift, a partner of Thomas Biddle. Then of N. Biddle, Burges Patterson and Cowperthwait. Resolution that the Chairman should write to Albert Gallatin andWright to make Oath about their refusal to loan money to Webb— I propose an amendment which was rejected 4 and 3, Resolution passed 4 and 3— Afternoon visit to Mrs. Rush—Williams— Walk met E. C. Watmough. then Stout and Caldclough— Evening with Watmough and M’Duffie at D. W. Coxes’s Music. Dominick Lynch.
13. VI. Friday.

lg.l: Een as a father to his child
The Lord is gracious to the just
And still compassionate and mild,
Remembers that we are but dust.
The days of men are but as grass
Who can his faded bloom restore?
Tis gone, as transient breezes pass—
Its place shall never know it more.
But thou for ages without end
Gracious to them thy name who fear
The children’s children shalt befriend
Of all who thy commands revere—
Jehovah reigns, enthron’d on high;
Let earth before him prostrate fall
He made the wonders of the sky
His kingdom ruleth over all.

div.p: Call on R. Walsh— He asked me if he should countenance proposals for presenting my name to the public. I said no—both for my sake and his own— He was much dissatisfied with Mr Clay: and thinks Clay hostile to him— Rundle’s 4 dividends Schuylkill Bridge Stock—96.— Bank—Lippincott Bank director examined. Wilson Hunt— Whitney’s Story to him. Whitney’s Story to him— Thomas’s snakish objection and misrepresentation— Philander Stephens—his Notes— James Brown, and J. Connell at my chamber. Connell has been to Boston.— Evening with Reed at the University. Exhibition of Speaking Original Composition by Juniors. J. Sergeant came home with me.
14. V:30. Saturday.

lg.l: O ye his Angels, praise the Lord,
Ye, his Commandment who fulfil;
Ye Mighty, hearken to his word
Ye Servants, who perform his will
Let the whole world his power confess
Wherever reaches his controul
His name let all Creation bless—
And bless the Lord, O thou my Soul.

div.p: Psalm 105.

lg.l: O, give ye thanks unto the Lord—
Ye Nations call upon his name;
Sing Psalms to him—his praise record
And all his wondrous works proclaim
Yes, to Jehovah, glory give
And ceaseless of his wonders speak
O, seek his presence while ye live
Jehovah, Lord of glory seek

div.p: At the Bank— Whitney’s explanatory Statement received.— Cambreleng’s sets of Resolutions, to which I objected—carried—against me. Resolution to leave a Sub-committee of six— Mr M’Duffie goes to-morrow morning— Correspondence about the removal of Jeremiah Mason, President of the Branch Bank at Portsmouth New-Hampshire, called for by Mr Watmough— Adjourn’d to meet at Washington The 20th.— Coll. R. M. Johnson’s transparency at the Arch Street theatre— Evening first at R. Walsh’s— Then at E. S. Burd’s—D. Lynch at both those houses— Sings and plays at both. Musicomania. Bullard F. C. Gray—Mrs Otis—Mrs Harrison—
15. VI. Sunday.

lg.l: Remember each transcendent deed
The judgments of his Mouth retrace
Ye, of his Servant Abraham’s seed
Children of Jacob’s chosen race
The Lord Jehovah is our God
O’er all the subject Earth he reigns
The promise sanction’d by his nod
Firm to the thousandth age remains.
The Covenant, with Abraham made—
The Oath to Isaac next reveal’d
The Law decreed for Jacob’s aid,
To Israel for all ages seal’d
“I give Canaan’s Land to you
The portion of your lot to stand—[”]
He said it, when they were but few—
But few, and Strangers in the Land.

div.p: Mr M’Duffie gone. Dr Caldwell here—

Went with Coll. Watmough to St. James’s Church. Heard Mr Morton Job:14.14. Sunday before Easter— With S. Bradford and Coll. R. M. Johnson heard Dr: Ezra Styles Ely from Matthew 16.27— At seven in the Evening went with Coll Johnson and Mr Thomas to the Jewish Synagogue accompanied by Mr Phillips Passover celebration. second Evening—Ark—Manuscript Rolls of Hebrew Pentateuch Too late for Unitarian Church. Evening at J. Sergeant’s.
16. VI Monday.

lg.l: While oer the desart wandering long
In weary pilgrimage they mov’d
He suffer’d now to do them wrong
And Monarchs for their sake reprov’d.
From Egypt’s borders as they fled
And pass’d successive kingdoms through
Touch mine anointed not—he said
Nor harms to these my prophets do.
He caus’d the harvest and the store
To fail—the garner’d grain to mould
But he had sent a man before
And Joseph, for a Slave was sold,
His limbs with heavy chains were bound
And iron fetters gall’d his feet
Till all the words he spoke were found
On trials prophesy complete

div.p: J. Vaughan— Duke of Sussex proposed as a member of the American Philosophical Society.
Met Subcommittee at the Bank Looked over papers—

Subcommittee adjourned without day. at my motion; leaving 4 members to receive the papers and explanations called for— Evening stormy— Judge Hopkinson called. I spent an hour with the Count de Survilliers; with his nephew and Mr Sarry his Secretary. He invited me to his place at Bordentown— Pack’d up and gave orders to be called at 4 to-morrow Morning.
17. IV. Tuesday— From Philadelphia to Washington.

lg.l: Then sent the king and set him free—
The People’s monarch let him go.
And of his household, by decree
The trust upon him did bestow.
That Egypt’s princes he might teach
Jehovah’s purpose to discern
And wisdom bring within the reach
Of Senators intent to learn
Then Israel into Egypt went—
And Jacob sojourn’d in the Land
And there the tribes of his descent
Prosper’d beneath Jehovah’s hand.
His blessing baffled all their foes
Though long by persecution tried,
Against them cruel hatred rose
Colleagued with insolence and pride
Moses and Aaron then he sent
The chosen of the great I am
His signs among them to present
His wonders in the Land of Ham
He quench’d of Light the radiant flood
While Jacob’s race his wont obey’d
He turn’d their waters into blood
And carrion of their fishes made.
And frogs oer all the region spread
Een in the chambers of their king
And flies in countless millions bred
And lice, and every crawling thing.
Hailstones he sent in place of rain
And scatter’d fires consuming blast.
He made their fig tree’s promise vain
And blight o’er all their vintage cast.

div.p: These four Stanzas composed on the way.

Rose at four, and reached the Steam-boat just in time at six. John Vaughan was there as usual to take leave— Mr Thomas is the only member of the Committee who came with me from Philadelphia, as far as Baltimore—Steam-boat William Penn to Newcastle— There at 40 minutes past 8— Thence in the Car on the Rail-road to Frenchtown. There at half-past ten. Steam-boat George Washington to Baltimore, where we arrived a quarter after three— Powhatan Ellis Senator from Mississippi was a passenger with us—returning from a visit to his brother sick at New-York. Lieutenant Thomas Ritchie, also, who remembered me as a fellow passenger in the John Adams from Gothenburg to the Texel— Thomas stopp’d for the Night at Baltimore. With Ellis, Ritchie and six others I took immediately a Stage of the line of Stockton and Stokes and came to Washington. We narrowly escaped broken necks in crossing the Bladensburg fountain bridge— One horse fell and the carriage was within an inch of being thrown over into the brook. We went round by the Navy-Yard to Land Mr Ellis, and at ten Minutes before Midnight I reached home— All abed— Mrs Pitts opened the door for me— [symbols]
18. VI. Wednesday— Washington

lg.l: He spoke, and caterpillars swarm’d
And locusts without number came.
Destructive hosts of insects form’d
And swept their herbage off like flame.
He smote all Egypt’s first born too
The chief of all their strength he broke
And brought the Sons of Israel through;
Nor left a feeble man to quake
And Egypt gladden’d as they went
The fear of them upon her fell;
He spread by day the Cloudy tent
By Night the fiery Pillar’s spell
The People asked,— Quails came in flocks,
And heavenly bread their wants supplied
Forth gush’d the waters from the rocks
And mountains fountains flood, when oer traverse dried

div.p: Attended the House of Representatives at 11— Presented Petition from—Inhabitants of Newbury-Port in behalf of Cherokee Indians—and Petition from Students of Williams College, to take off Postage from Pamphlets and Newspapers— Samuel Houston at the Bar with his Counsel F. S. Key— Protest against the jurisdiction of the House. Then Challenges a member for having expressed an unfavourable opinion on him and his cause— After some discussion this challenge was withdrawn— Houston answers the interrogatories—adjourned at three— Mr Duponceau came to see me this Evening in great concern about his Silk worm bill.
19. V.15. Thursday

lg.l: Still to his Holy promise true
Once to his Servant Abraham made
He brought with joy his people through
His chosen race with songs convey’d
To them he gave Canaan’s Lands
That they his Statutes might record
To reap the spoils of heathen bands
And keep his Laws— Praise ye the Lord.

div.p: Psalm 106.

lg.l: Praise ye the Lord—the anthem swell
Thanks to eternal goodness raise
O who his mighty deeds can tell
O who can shew forth all his praise.
And blest is he whose righteous heart
Swerves never from thy just decree
O Lord to me thy gracious part
Let thy Salvation visit me.

div.p: H.R.U.S. at 11. Call of House. Vote by yeas and nays, and call suspended. Plummer finished a silly and Sycophantic speech, begun yesterday upon the Collector of Wiscasset’s case— Saml Houston at the Bar— Message to S.US requesting the attendance of four Senators to testify— They came—Grundy, Buckner, Tipton andWilliam Stanberry testifies to the assault and battery Cross questioned. by Houston’s Counsel Dickson objects to it 102 to 82 that it shall be put. Then an entangled discussion, till past five O’Clock. adjourn’d.
20. V. Good Friday.

lg.l: That I thy goodness may behold
And to thy glory tune the song
O Lord, our fathers sinn’d of old
We have like them committed wrong
Thy wonders never did they heed
In Egypt, and the Red Sea shown—
Yet thou to save them hadst decreed—
To make thy power and goodness known
At his rebuke the Sea was dried
The depths and wilds he led them through
Success to all their foes denied
And from their hands redeem’d them too
The waters overwhelm’d their foes
Not one was left the tale to tell—
Then to his praise loud anthems rose—
Then they his words remember’d well.

div.p: H.R.U.S. at 11. Yeas and nays taken for a call of the house— No Quorum— Call immediately suspended. I offered my Resolution of Call for the biennial Register. Lays over Resolution for Committee to examine and report on Precedents. Laid on the Table. Trial of Saml Houston— Answer of W. Stanbery— Resolution of yesterday Motion to reconsider rejected— Key objects to admission of Luther Blakes affidavit—re discussion The affidavit read Question whether to receive it or not— Left unsettled.
21. IV:15. Saturday.

lg.l: But soon, too soon his works forgot
And brought upon themselves the rod
For heavenly Counsel waited not
But in the desert tempted God.
On their vile lust he set his stamp,
By Pestilence amid their feast
They envied Moses in the Camp,
And Aaron, God’s anointed Priest.
Abiram, his rebellious hand
With Dathan leagued, to raise presum’d
Earth opening swallow’d up their band
And fire the rebel host consum’d.
In Horeb next, that wicked race
A molten calf to worship flocks—
See—in the God of Glory’s place
The likeness of a grazing Ox.

div.p: Met the Bank Committee in the Room of the Committee on Commerce. All the Members present— To ask till next week to report. H.R:U.S— Saml Houston’s trial T. H. Hall’s Resolution— On asking yeas and nays, withdrawn. Stanbery’s testimony concluded—numerous interrogatories. Joseph Vance’s testimony and Cave Johnson’s— Proposed Resolution of Horace Everett—adjourned.
Young Midshipman Clinton, and Ex-Cadet Dughes were here in the Evening— Lines requested for Miss M. Carson.
22. IV:15. Easter Sunday.

lg.l: Yes, God, their Saviour they forgot
And all his deeds in Egypt done—
His wondrous works remember’d not
Where the red Ocean’s waters run
Forth went the mandate to destroy
But Moses turn’d his wrath away
Yea—they despis’d the land of joy
His holy word contemned they.
Through all their Tents loud murmurs rose
Jehovah’s warning voice they spurn’d
In them, the Lord beheld his foes
And Anger fierce against them burn’d
Their seed was scatter’d oer the Lands
Among the Nations they were spread
Then join’d they Baalpeor’s bands
And victims slew to Idols dead.

div.p: Heard Mr Campbell of Albany. Matthew 21–27.28–29.30. W and Mrs Lee— Mr James B. O. Tayloe and Miss Blodget. Campbell’s discourse extemporaneous— Visit this morning from Captain James Taylor of Kentucky. Afternoon heard Mr Smith from Mark 5.17.— Mrs. George Sullivan and her Son here after dinner. Letters to D. Webster and Lieutenant T. B. Adams— Mr Frye here this Evening. Bank-Committee Counter-report.
23. V:15. Monday.

lg.l: Thus the Lord’s wrath did they provoke
But Phineas slew the guilty pair
And when the plague upon them broke
Made the avenging hand forbear
And this to all succeeding times
To him has been accounted praise
But Israel, with repeated crimes,
Ceas’d not Jehovah’s wrath to raise.
Thus at Meribah—stream of strife—
The very tongue of Moses slips—
And once throughout a blameless life—
He spoke with unadvised lips.
The Lord commands they disobey’d
The heathen Nations not to spare
But mingled worship with them paid,
And found their Idols foul, a snare—

div.p: Visited at the Committee room of the judiciary Committee of the Senate a model of an equestrian Statue and a laurel crown’d bust of Washington. H.R.U.S. Houston’s trial. Examination of witnesses. Grundy, Buckner and Tipton of the Senate. Hall and Shaw—question to discredit Luther Blake taken by yeas and nays— Adjourn till 11. to-morrow— Petition received this morning. Blue-book laid on our Tables— General Macomb here this Eve— At P.U.S. evening before last— He denies the privilege of the House—
24. IV:30. Tuesday.

lg.l: To devils Friends the sacrifice they paid
To Idols pour’d th’ensanguin’d flood
Yea their own children victims made
And soil’d Canaan’s land with blood.
From vile foul pollutions unreclaim’d
They rous’d the anger of the Lord
Till his own people he disclaimed
His own inheritance abhorr’d
He gave them up to heathen hands
Slaves to their most detested foes—
Dispers’d them over distant Lands
And tried them with Oppression’s woes
Their Tyrants often though he quell’d
Oft punish’d their obdurate pride—
Still their affliction he beheld
And gracious listen’d when they cried.

div.p: Bank Committee at 1/2 past nine—overtook and walked with Cambreleng. All present— Chairman asks till to-morrow to make his report— Accounts of the Committee to be audited. In Congress Library— The Volumes of Hatsell, Hallam’s Constitutional History and of Burke which I wanted all out. H.R.U.S. Houston’s trial. Witnesses for him examined. Shaw—Murray—Captn. Hawkins E. S. Davis—

Coxe and D. A. Hall for the prosecution— Evidence closed— Stanberry offers to prove the fraud— Polk pledges himself to offer a Resolution for investigating it— Key to make his argument to-morrow— Taylor spoke to me of Stanberry. M. Hogan here this Evening.
25. V.15. Wednesday

lg.l: He reign’d in tender mercy still
Nor eer his promises forgot
But bent the haughty victors will
To mitigate the captive’s lot.
O God thy chosen tribes restore
And everlasting praise be thine
In praise till time shall be no more
Let all thy ransom’d people join.

div.p: Psalm 107.

lg.l: Thanks to the Lord Jehovah give
His mercies ever shall endure
Let the redeemed while they live
Proclaim his promise ever sure
East, West, North, South, from all the Lands
They wound their solitary way
Nor could their wandering weary bands
Find in the desert where to stay.

div.p: Solomon Drew here—
Bank Committee for Committee of Claims— Chairman Clayton read part of his Report— Six forfeitures of the Charter— Adjourn’d at 11.
H.R.U.S trial of S. Houston Jonathan Elliot jr. testified.
Jonathan Elliot—
Ewing—Senator from Ohio Alexander Buckner from Missouri Stanberry asks for T. H. Benton to discredit him.

Duff Green called, to prove the fraud. objected to by Wickliffe. Reconsideration— Motions of order— Vote by yeas and nays Duff Green set aside as a witness— Stanberry charges the President with interference— Bates of Maine, his simple Question— Hawes of Kentucky: his question—
26. V. Thursday.

lg.l: Their Souls within them sank dismay’d
With hunger and with thirst oppress’d—
Then to the Lord they cried for aid
And he reliev’d them thus distress’d.
He led them in the best of ways
A permanent abode to find
O, that the race of man would praise
His wondrous goodness to mankind.
He fills the hungry Soul with food
The longing Spirit he sustains
Though in the shade of death they brood
Fast bound in wretchedness and chains
For they against their God rebell’d
Jehovah’s Counsel they disdain’d
But he their lofty Spirit quell’d—
They fell—no helping hand sustain’d—

div.p: Solomon Drew again.
Bank Committee again at Committee of Commerce’s room— Mr Clayton read more of his report—
F. P. Blair’s liabilities and non payments— W. T. Barry. Manhattan Bank.
Clayton’s selection of cases for comment.
I took the papers relating to R. M. Whitney’s Testimony
H.R.U.S—
Ashley’s Resolution Benton’s Declaration Stanberry’s Apology. F. S. Key’s Argument for Houston—2 hours and a half—then postponed in the middle— Adjourned before three. Sirocco—
27. V. Friday.

lg.l: Then to the Lord they cried for aid—
Salvation issued his decree
He brought them from Death’s dreary shade
He broke their bonds, and set them free
O. how the works of God surpass,
Ye Sons of Man, all praise from you
Twas he that broke the gates of brass
He sever’d iron bars in two.
Fools for Transgression were chastis’d—
Chastis’d with punishment severe—
Their Souls, sustaining food despis’d
And to the gates of death drew near
Then cried they, troubled to the Lord,
And found Salvation in his Laws—
He sent to them his healing word
And sav’d them from Destruction’s jaws.

div.p: Bank Committee at 9. Chairman Clayton’s Report continued; not finished. H.R.U.S. at 11. F. S. Key indisposed. Could not come to the house. Houston’s trial postponed till to-morrow— Apportionment Bill from Senate Polk moves reference to a select Committee—debate Carried—

Appropriation Bill from the Senate Committee of the whole on the State of the Union. Wickliffe in the Chair— Item outfit for Minister to France debated— Bill reported to the house— Secy of the Treasury’s Tariff Bill and Report received—ordered to be printed and referred to the Committee on Manufactures. Mrs Frye and Thomas dined with us.
28. VI. Saturday.

lg.l: O, that the race of Man would raise
Their voices to their heavenly king
And with the sacrifice of praise
The glories of Jehovah sing
Ye Navigators of the Sea
Your course on Oceans tides who keep
And there, Jehovah’s wonders see—
His wonders in the briny deep—
He speaks—conflicting whirlwinds fly
The waves in swelling torrents flow
They mount as if to Heaven on high,
They sink as if to Hell below.
Their Souls with terrors melt away
They stagger as if drunk with wine
Their skill is vain—to thee they pray
O, save them, Energy divine.

div.p: Bank Committee at 9. Chairman’s Report, reading by paragraphs. I mov’d to make a short Report this day— My proposition was rejected by yeas and nays 4 and 3. Committee to meet informally to morrow at 10— H.R.U.S— Key still sick. Houston’s trial adjourn’d to Monday— Resolutions—Boon—Doddridge—Mine—the Blue Book—laid on the Table— Hubbard’s Pension-Bill—postponed—Appropriation Bill—Outfit for Minister to France. Archer—Drayton, Wayne vs Everett, Ingersoll, Doddridge. M’Duffie— I spoke about an hour—vote 102. 77. Other questions—adjourn’d on call for yeas and nays— Met M’Duffie and Watmough in room of Comee of Commerce— Evening rain.
29. VI. Sunday.

lg.l: He stays the Storm, the waves subside
Their hearts with rapture are inspir’d
Soft breezes waft them oer the tide
In gladness to their Port desir’d.
O that Mankind the Song would raise
Jehovah’s goodness to proclaim
Assembled Nations shout his praise
Assembled Elders bless his name
He turns the rivers to a Strand
He drains the water-fountains dry
He blasts with barrenness the Land
Its Sins with punishment to try
He turns the desart to a Lake
He makes the gushing fountain swell
Their fast he bids the famish’d break
And build a City where to dwell.

div.p: Capitol at 10. J. Taliaferro. Bank Committee. Chairman’s report by Paragraphs continued Left them— Heard in Hall H.R.U.S.from Psalm 78.34–39. Return’d to the Committee, and sat with them till 3.—left them again to meet at 1/2 past 9 to-morrow Morning— M’Duffie returned my unfinished manuscript advising erasures. The Carriage was passing by as I came out. Rode to Presbyterian Church. heard Smith from Psalm 119.80. Mrs Lee told me R. G. Amory was very ill— Mrs G. Sullivan was there—and Mr James. Evening rain— Writing. J. Connell here— Spoke of my yesterday’s Speech. so did Coll. R. M. Johnson.
30. VI. Monday.

lg.l: To plant the Vineyards, Fields to sow
With harvests, yielding large increase
He makes abundant blessings flow
And bids them multiply in Peace
Again, Oppression brings them down
Affliction, Sorrow hedge their way
He tramples on the Monarchs crown
And Princes in the desert stray
The poor, exalted by his voice
Are set upon the mountaintop
The righteous see it and rejoice
And wickedness her mouth shall stop.
Their families oerspread the Land
Hark—ye who venerate his word
The wise, shall mark and understand
The loving kindness of the Lord.

div.p: Bank Committee—Majority agreed to the Report— Moderated by R. M. Johnson. Milk and Water Resolution. I left the Committee before they finished— Found the House in Session— Yeas and nays taking. my name passed. Appropriation Bill—debates thereon— Suspended by Clayton’s Bank Committee Report. M’Duffie’s immediate reply, Clayton’s rejoinder. Hubbard moves previous question. Fails— My notice of protest against the Report. Cambreleng F. Thomas. R. M. Johnson Watmough all speak. Report and Documents to be printed. Clay moves for 10000 copies of the Report— Not carried. Dr. Dyott Jonas B. Brown, Redwood Fisher andHumes of Philadelphia here— Tariff Report Conversation. Dyott’s two boys. Clerk from Treasury Department here.
Vous etes orfevre, Monsieur Josse, et votre conseil sent son homme qui a envie de se défaire de sa Marchandise.
L’amour Medecin Acte 1. Sc. 1.
The envy also of Ephraim shall depart, and the adversaries of Judah shall be cut off— Ephraim shall not envy Judah, and Judah shall not vex Ephraim Isaiah 11.13.
